docs.title: PipelineScript
docs.text:
Human-readable ML pipeline language (DSL) for building, debugging, and visualizing machine learning pipelines.

  • PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/pipelinescript/
  • GitHub: https://github.com/idrissbado/PipelineScript

docs.title: Why PipelineScript?
docs.text:
• Write pipelines in plain text: load, clean, encode, split, train, evaluate
  • Debug interactively with breakpoints and context inspection
  • Visualize pipelines (ASCII or matplotlib)
  • Use CLI or Python API

docs.title: Install
docs.text:
pip install pipelinescript
# Optional extras
pip install pipelinescript[full]

docs.title: Quick Example (DSL)
docs.text:
load iris.csv
clean missing
encode
split 80/20 --target species
train random_forest
evaluate
export iris_model.pkl

docs.title: Quick Example (Python)
docs.text:
from pipelinescript import Pipeline

result = (Pipeline()
    .load("data.csv")
    .clean_missing()
    .encode()
    .split(0.8, target="label")
    .train("xgboost")
    .evaluate()
    .run())

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
• Report issues: https://github.com/idrissbado/PipelineScript/issues
  • Discussions: https://github.com/idrissbado/PipelineScript/discussions

docs.title: CLI
docs.text:
pipelinescript run <file.psl> [--visualize]

Options: - --visualize: render ASCII or graphical diagram of the pipeline

docs.title: Classification
docs.text:
load titanic.csv
clean missing
encode
split 80/20 --target survived
train random_forest
evaluate

docs.title: Regression
docs.text:
load housing.csv
clean outliers
select bedrooms bathrooms sqft price
scale
split 75/25 --target price
train linear
evaluate

docs.title: How to Install PipelineScript Package
docs.text: This guide explains how to install and get started with the pipelinescript Python package.

docs.title: Basic Installation
docs.text: pip install pipelinescript

docs.title: With XGBoost Support
docs.text: pip install pipelinescript[xgboost]

docs.title: With Visualization Support
docs.text: pip install pipelinescript[viz]

docs.title: Full Installation (All Features)
docs.text: pip install pipelinescript[full]

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
python -m pipelinescript --help

Or in Python:

import pipelinescript
print(pipelinescript.__version__)

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Create my_pipeline.psl:

load data.csv
clean missing
encode
split 80/20 --target label
train random_forest
evaluate
export model.pkl

Run it:

pipelinescript run my_pipeline.psl

docs.title: Python API
docs.text:
from pipelinescript import Pipeline

result = (Pipeline()
    .load("data.csv")
    .clean_missing()
    .encode()
    .split(0.8, target="label")
    .train("random_forest")
    .evaluate()
    .run())

print(f"Accuracy: {result.context.metrics['accuracy']}")

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.8 or higher
  • pip (Python package installer)
  • Windows, macOS, or Linux

docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text:
The pipelinescript package automatically installs: - pandas >= 1.3.0 - numpy >= 1.21.0 - scikit-learn >= 1.0.0

Optional dependencies: - xgboost >= 1.5.0 (for XGBoost models) - matplotlib >= 3.5.0 (for visualization)

docs.title: Package Not Found
docs.text:
If you get "package not found" errors:

pip install --upgrade pip
pip install pipelinescript

docs.title: Import Errors
docs.text:
Make sure you're using Python 3.8+:

python --version

docs.title: CLI Not Working
docs.text:
Try using the module syntax:

python -m pipelinescript run pipeline.psl

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Quick Start Guide
  • Language Reference
  • Python API Documentation
  • Examples

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
• Package on PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/pipelinescript/
  • Source Code: https://github.com/idrissbado/PipelineScript
  • Report Issues: https://github.com/idrissbado/PipelineScript/issues

docs.title: Language Reference
docs.text:
Commands:

  • load <path>
  • clean missing|duplicates|outliers
  • encode
  • scale
  • split <ratio> --target <col>
  • train <model>
  • evaluate
  • export <file>

docs.title: PipelineScript Package for Python
docs.text: PipelineScript is a Python package that provides a human-readable domain-specific language (DSL) for building machine learning pipelines.

docs.title: Install the PipelineScript Package
docs.text: pip install pipelinescript

docs.title: What is PipelineScript Package?
docs.text: The pipelinescript package allows you to: - Write ML pipelines in plain English - Debug pipelines interactively - Visualize data flow - Export production-ready models

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
Install the package:

pip install pipelinescript

Create a pipeline script (.psl file):

load iris.csv
clean missing
encode
split 80/20 --target species
train random_forest
evaluate
export model.pkl

Run with the pipelinescript package:

pipelinescript run pipeline.psl

Or use the Python API:

from pipelinescript import Pipeline

pipeline = (Pipeline()
    .load("data.csv")
    .clean_missing()
    .encode()
    .split(0.8, target="label")
    .train("xgboost")
    .evaluate()
    .run())

docs.title: PipelineScript Package Features
docs.text:
• ✅ Human-readable syntax
  • ✅ Interactive debugger
  • ✅ Built-in visualization
  • ✅ scikit-learn integration
  • ✅ XGBoost support
  • ✅ CLI and Python API

docs.text:

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: #pipelinescript #python #machinelearning #dsl #mlops #datascience #sklearn #xgboost #pipeline #automation

docs.title: Python API
docs.text:
from pipelinescript import Pipeline

pipeline = (Pipeline()
    .load("data.csv")
    .clean_missing()
    .encode()
    .split(0.8, target="label")
    .train("xgboost")
    .evaluate())

result = pipeline.run()

docs.title: 1. Install
docs.text: pip install pipelinescript

docs.title: 2. Create a .psl file
docs.text:
my_pipeline.psl

load iris.csv
clean missing
encode
split 80/20 --target species
train random_forest
evaluate
export iris_model.pkl

docs.title: 3. Run
docs.text:
CLI:

pipelinescript run my_pipeline.psl

Python:

from pipelinescript import run
result = run("my_pipeline.psl")
